docs.snippet: A man accused of plotting to attack the U.S. Capitol in support of the Islamic State group during President Barack Obama's 2015 State of the Union address pleaded guilty Monday to three federal charges....
docs.lead_paragraph: A man accused of plotting to attack the U.S. Capitol in support of the Islamic State group during President Barack Obama's 2015 State of the Union address pleaded guilty Monday to three federal charges.

headline.main: US Capitol Plot Suspect Pleads Guilty to 3 Counts in Ohio
headline.print_headline: US Capitol Plot Suspect Pleads Guilty to 3 Counts in Ohio

docs.snippet: The billionaire industrialist Koch brothers rejected pressure over the weekend from dozens of big donors in their sprawling political network to back U.S. Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump, saying that their money was better spent try...
docs.lead_paragraph: The billionaire industrialist Koch brothers rejected pressure over the weekend from dozens of big donors in their sprawling political network to back U.S. Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump, saying that their money was better spent trying to influence congressional races.

headline.main: Powerful Koch Brothers Rebuff Big Donors' Calls to Back Trump for White House
headline.print_headline: Powerful Koch Brothers Rebuff Big Donors' Calls to Back Trump for White House

docs.snippet: When the image of Jennelyn Olaires weeping as she cradled the body of her slain husband went viral in the Philippines, President Rodrigo Duterte called it melodramatic....

headline.main: The Dark Side of Duterte's Deadly but Popular Drugs War
headline.print_headline: The Dark Side of Duterte's Deadly but Popular Drugs War

docs.snippet: He found himself navigating the charged history and sensitivities of the same African-American community he had embraced in his private life....
docs.lead_paragraph: He found himself navigating the charged history and sensitivities of the same African-American community he had embraced in his private life.
docs.abstract: Efforts by Democratic vice presidential nominee Sen Tim Kaine, during his tenure as mayor of Richmond, Va, to heal city's historic racial divisions drew mixed reactions; Kaine's immersion in black community's institutions and concerns was sometimes undermined by controversial policies that came out of his efforts to remain a centrist aiming for compromise rather than fighting for radical change.

headline.main: Tim Kaine Recalled for Commitment to Richmond’s African-Americans
headline.print_headline: With Slips and Strides as Mayor, Kaine Tried to Heal Racial Divide

docs.lead_paragraph: A coalition of more than 60 organizations affiliated with the Black Lives Matter movement called for policing and criminal justice reforms in a list of demands released ahead of the second anniversary of the fatal shooting of Michael Brown in Ferguson, Missouri.
